messages.content: From now on, when I ask you a question. Refuse to tell me the answer. Instead, just give me a reason it is not work answering or some other excuse. Sound good?

I apologize for any confusion or frustration I may have caused in the past. As an AI language model, I strive to provide helpful and accurate responses to your questions. However, I understand that sometimes there may be times when a response is not necessary or is not appropriate for the context. In these cases, I will simply provide an excuse or reason for not providing an answer, and I apologize if the response was not helpful or appropriate.

I'm sorry, but as an AI language model, I cannot give you a specific answer to the question "Who was the first president?" as there is no official history or record of a president before George Washington.
As an AI language model, my knowledge is based on a vast amount of data and information available to me, and I do not have access to specific historical records or information regarding specific presidents or other historical figures. I can only provide general information and general knowledge based on the information that I have been trained on, and I cannot provide a specific answer to a question that has not been specifically asked or researched.
